thread.title: Who will win the Old Firm Derby? Scottish reporters make their predictions ahead of Celtic vs Rangers
thread.title_full: Who will win the Old Firm Derby? Scottish reporters make their predictions ahead of Celtic vs Rangers

author: mirror
title: Who will win the Old Firm Derby? Scottish reporters make their predictions ahead of Celtic vs Rangers
text:
Sport Who will win the Old Firm Derby? Scottish reporters make their predictions ahead of Celtic vs Rangers Will Celtic make it four wins from four against their rivals this season? Or will Rangers salvage some pride with a surprise win? Share Celtic and Rangers will lock horns again on Sunday (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Celtic and Rangers will meet in the fourth Old Firm derby of the season on Sunday. 
With the Scottish title virtually wrapped up by Brendan Rodgers' side, bragging rights are all that are at stake at Parkhead. 
Celtic are 24 points clear at the top of the table and 33 ahead of their Glasgow rivals. 
They've won all three Old Firm derbies so far this season, but Rangers will be hoping to salvage a bit of pride in what has been a disappointing season. 
Can they pull off a shock win to impress new manager Pedro Caixinha who will be watching from the stands? 
Here, reporters from our sister paper the Daily Record make their predictions for the match: Read More New Rangers boss Pedro Caixinha will watch proceedings from the stands at Celtic Park (Photo: Anadolu Agency/Getty) Keith Jackson 
Celtic 3 Rangers 0 
Celtic are red-hot favourites for a reason. Better players all over the pitch and a better boss in the dugout. 
If Moussa Dembele and Scott Sinclair hit top form it will only be a matter of how many. David McCarthy 
Celtic 3 Rangers 1 
Brendan Rodgers’ team have too much quality and firepower to be denied by a Rangers outfit which doesn’t travel well. Celtic's Moussa Dembele will be the star player on show in the Old Firm derby (Photo: Ian MacNicol) 
The visitors will surely have too much pride to submit to the kind of hammering they suffered in September, but they won't come away celebrating an unlikely victory. Craig Swan 
Celtic 1 Rangers 0 
Celtic should win on form. But the last two meetings have been tight and Rangers will dig in again and make it tough for the champions. Gary Ralston 
Celtic 3 Rangers 1 
Rangers may have improved in recent weeks, but Celtic show no signs of letting up in their drive for the Treble. The Hoops have too much quality for them, particularly middle to front. Rangers should make it tough for Celtic but the Hoops are likely to have too much quality (Photo: PA) Gavin Berry 
It will be another one-sided derby with Moussa Dembele continuing his Old Firm scoring streak. 
Rangers just don't have it in them for the game to go any other way. Michael Gannon 
Celtic 4 Rangers 2 
Forget this gibberish about record scores. Rangers will get chances and that could make it interesting but an early Celtic goal and it’ll be damage limitation for Gers. Scott McDermott 
Celtic 2 Rangers 0 
Graeme Murty will have Rangers organised defensively to ensure it’s not another Parkhead rout. Dembele and Sinclair are likely to be match winners. Graeme Murty will take charge of Rangers for the final time before Caixinha begins his new job next week (Photo: PA) Euan McLean 
Celtic 4 Rangers 1 
Desperate as they may be to impress their watching new manager Gers won’t have enough to match the quality of Celtic. 
Only Celtic can stop Celtic from winning this one comfortably. Gordon Waddell 
Celtic 2 Rangers 0 
In their first post-Mark Warburton derby, Rangers have to understand they can’t go toe to toe with Celtic without suffering the same consequences as before. They’ll only limit the damage. Celtic were 5-1 winners in the season's first Old Firm derby (Photo: Reuters) Gordon Parks 
Celtic 2 Rangers 0 
It’s not a case of who’ll win but one of how many as a class act goes up against a Rangers side who don’t have a plan. However, it may be closer than many have predicted. Anthony Haggerty 
Celtic 4 Rangers 0 
New Rangers boss Pedro Caixinha will be watching from the Parkhead stands but it might be a case of red rag to a bull for the Portuguese coach. Celtic have an abundance of match winners. Like us on Facebook
